Description: Rim and neck sherd of Milesian Middle Wild Goat II Style pottery krater; orange fabric with large quantity of mica and large limestone inclusions; interior: wide band at rim; exterior, white slip: reserved on top and underside of rim, black band on edge; on neck, narrow black band at top; below, large black (in part fired red) maeander and square frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.830.a. See Schlotzhauer 2012 for further bibliography
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 125-6, Nau 87, pl. 20a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.024)
